org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Class AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
      • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data to be masked.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDictionaryMasker<T>, IInstanceMasker<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractReplaceInstMasker, ConstantShiftDateMasker, ConstantShiftDecimalMasker, RandomShiftDateMasker, RandomShiftDecimalMasker

    public abstract class AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<T>
extends AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
implements IInstanceMasker<T>, IDictionaryMasker<T>
    Performs data masking on a dictionary of values of type T by applying instance masking on each value. Inheriting classes need only implement the mask() method for instance-based data masking. maskList() is automatically provided and uses the instance-based method for each element in the dictionary.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractInstBasedDictMasker()

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void maskList(java.util.List<T> data)
      Masks the given dictionary one data instance at a time by calling the mask method for each element of the list.
      java.lang.String maskString(java.lang.String input, IDataParser<T> parser)
      Interprets the input string as a data instance of type T, performs data masking on it and returns the masked data, converted back to a string.

      • maskString

        public java.lang.String maskString(java.lang.String input,
                          IDataParser<T> parser)
        Interprets the input string as a data instance of type T, performs data masking on it and returns the masked data, converted back to a string.
        Parameters:
        input - The string representing a data instance.
        parser - The parser used to interpret the string as data - usually a DataType.
        Returns:
        The string representing the masked data.
